results.title: Les Doigts Dans la Tete = Fingers in the Head
results.brief_description:
A young apprentice baker is fired by his boss. Since his room is included as part of his wages, and he cannot afford to leave, Chris decides to barricade himself in his room with a motley crue including a male friend, two girlfriends, a waitress and a Swedish hippie. Shot in black and white on 16mm with a largely amateur cast, this film is an excellent example of the young cinema of the 1970s.

Credits: Director, Jacques Doillon ; writers, Jacques Doillon, Philippe Defrance ; photography, Yves Lafaille.
Cast: Christophe Soto, Olivier Bousquet, Ann Zacharias, Roselyne Vuillaume, Gabriel Bernard, Martin Trevieres, Pierre Fabien, Francois Beranger.

results.title: La Femme Infidele = the Unfaithful Wife
results.creator_credit: Andre Genoves, Les Films La Boetie, Cinegai and Claude Chabrol
results.brief_description:
A respectable middle-class husband, complacently happy in his marriage, discovers that is wife has been having an affair with another man. He confronts the lover and kills him in an attempt to save his marriage. This film is the first of a trilogy on adultery (all starring Chabrol’s then wife, Stephane Audran) including ‘La Rupture/The Breakup’ (1970) and ‘Juste avant la Nuit/Just before Nightfall’ (1971). Also available on VHS.

Credits: Producer, Andre Genoves ; director, Claude Chabrol ; writer, Claude Chabrol ; photography, Jean Rabier ; music, Pierre Jansen ; art direction, Guy Littaye ; editor, Jacques Gaillard.
Cast: Michel Bouquet, Stephane Audran, Maurice Ronet, Michel Duchaussoy, Donatella Turi.

results.title: Le Capitan
results.creator_credit: Rene Bezard, Pierre Caband, Paul Cadeac and Andre Hunebelle
results.brief_description:
In 1616 King Louis XIII is only 15 and his kingdom is administered by Regent Marie de Medicis and her favourite, Concini. Concini hopes to use power and influence to overthrow the young king but his plan is violently opposed by the peers of the Kingdom who have their own candidate to the succession, Charles d’Angouleme. As Concini terrorises his opponents, the kingdom is on the verge of a civil war. In order to save his life and his throne, the young king enlists the help of Francois, also known as Le Capitan, the best swashbuckler of the kingdom, and his sidekick, Cogolin.

Credits: Producers, Paul Cadeac, Pierre Caband, Rene Bezard ; director, Andre Hunebelle ; writers, Jean Halain, Pierre Foucaud, Andre Hunebelle ; photography, Marcel Grignon ; music, Jean Marion.
Cast: Pierrette Bruno, Lise Delamare, Annie Anderson, Guy Delorme, Jean Marais.

results.title: Inherit the wind
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kramer and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Inspired by the famous “Monkey Trial” of 1925, when a school teacher in Tennessee stood accused of teaching Darwin’s theory of evolution, this outstanding courtroom drama embodies the century old debate between Evolutionists and Creationists. The tightly woven script is highlighted by the timeless performances of Spencer Tracy and Fredric March as the defense and prosecution attorneys, Gene Kelly as the cynical, progressive reporter and Dick York as the young teacher.

results.title: Les Granges Brulees = the Burned Barns
results.brief_description:
A crime has been committed near an isolated farm called ‘Les Granges Brulees’, in the mountains of Jura. The farm is owned by Rose, the pillar on which her family depend and against which it pulls. Judge Larcher is in charge of the investigation and every piece of evidence points towards Rose’s youngest son. As the investigation progresses, Larcher becomes drawn into the secrets of Rose’s clan, digging up painful truths about each member of this apparently closely knit family.

Credits: Producer, Ralph Baum ; director, Jean Chapot ; writers, Jean Chapot, Sebastien Roulet ; photography, Sacha Vierny ; music, Jean-Michel Jarre.
Cast: Alain Delon, Simone Signoret, Paul Crauchet, Bernard Le Coq, Miou-Miou, Renato Salvatori, Jean Bouise, Christian Barbier, Fernand Ledoux.

results.title: Un Sac de Billes = a Bag of Marbles
results.brief_description:
At the end of 1941, two jewish boys, Maurice, 13, and Joseph, 10, living in Paris are forced to wear a yellow star. This does not have much significance for them and they quickly swap them for a bag full of marbles. Chastised by their father, they learn about the surrounding dangers and are told they must leave their family to go and seek refuge in the ‘Free Zone’ with their two elder brothers. When the German Army invades the Zone, the children are arrested. In order to recover their freedom (and save their lives) the children must convince a priest to deliver them with a christening certificate.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Grunstein ; director, Jacques Doillon ; writers, Jacques Doillon, Denis Ferraris ; photography, Yves Lafaye ; music, Philippe Sarde.
Cast: Paul Eric Schulmann, Richard Constantini, Joseph Goldenberg, Reine Barteve, Michel Robin, Dominique Davros, Gilles Laurent, Gilles Laurent, Hubert Drac.

results.title: Sex, lies and videotape
results.creator_credit: Steven Soderbergh, John Hardy, Robert Newmyer and Outlaw Productions
results.brief_description: A selfish, successful lawyer (Peter Gallagher) - whose wife (Andie MacDowell) has been turned off sex is having an affair with his sister-in-law (Laura San Giacomo). He welcomes an old college friend (James Spader) for a visit, not realising the amazing effect that he will have on all of them. A finely honed tale of adultery, impotence and dangerous liaisons. Strong women, weak men; a quartet defined by their erotic impulses and inhibitions. This is Steven Soderbergh’s first feature, and it won him Best Film and James Spader Best Actor at the Cannes Film Festival in 1989.

results.title: Le Schpountz = Heartbeat
results.brief_description:
A film-fan grocer is the victim of a practical joke played on him by a film crew touring his district of provence. He arrives at the studio in Paris on their false promises, but reveals himself as a successful comic. Reference: Bloomsbury Foreign Film Guide. Awards: International Moscow Film Festival (1959): Special Prize.

Credits: Director, Marcel Pagnol ; writer, Marcel Pagnol ; photography, Willy ; music, Casimir Oberfeld.
Cast: Fernandel, Charpin, Odette Roger, Jean Castan, Orane Demazis, Leon Belieres, Maupi.

results.title: Quelque Part, Quelqu'un = Somewhere, Someone
results.brief_description:
Raphaelle, a young architect, is attempting to balance the demands of her work with the needs of the men around her. One of these men with needs is Vincent, her boyfriend, whom she tries to rescue from alcholic stupor in the hope he will finish his novel.

Credits: Director, Yannick Bellon ; writer, Yannick Bellon ; photography, Georges Barsky ; music, Georges Delerue.
Cast: Loleh Bellon, Roland Dubillard, Christine Tsingos, Hugues Quester, Helene Dieudonne.

results.title: Solo
results.brief_description:
Vincent is a cello player and occasional drug dealer. On his way back to Paris he is informed that his brother Virgile is accused of criminal acts perpetrated on behalf of a group of revolutionary students. In a race against time, Vincent decides to get to his runaway brother before the police does.

Credits: Producer, Gilbert Marion ; director, Jean-Pierre Mocky ; writers, Alain Moury, Jean-Pierre Mocky ; photography, Marcel Weiss ; music, Georges Moustaki ; editor, Marguerite Renoir.
Cast: Jean-Pierre Mocky, Sylvie Breal, Anne Deleuze, Denis Le Guillou, Henri Poirier, R. J. Chauffard.
